column1: Pilimathalawa and this was also marked as an omission.
In Aadam Kasam Shaikh vs. The State of Maharashtra, 2006 Cr LJ 4585 (4589), the Court held
"The  evidence  of  a  witness  cannot  be  discarded  merely  because  he  had  made
improvements  over  his  police  statements  by  stating  some  of  the  facts  for  the  first
time  in his  deposition  before the  court,  if  the  facts  stated  for  the  first  time  before
the court is in the nature of elaboration, do not amount to a contradiction, and the
evidence of witness does not militate against his earlier version".
